summary: Congress designed the U.S. Postal Service to be self-sustaining—covering its costs primarily by selling products and delivering mail and packages. But mail volumes have been declining and USPS has lost money almost every year since 2007. As a result, USPS’s financial viability has been on our High Risk List since 2009. title: U.S. Postal Service Primer: Updated Answers to Key Questions About Reform Issues
